0: AIR Force One is the ultimate symbol of the US President's power and authority. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The aircraft prominently bears the the American flag on its outside, making it instantly recognisable. Here's what we know... NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR AP:Associated Press 4 President Donald Trump boards Air Force One for a trip to Las Vegas NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR What is Air Force One? NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Air Force One is one of two specially modified Boeing 747-200B jets which carries the US President. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Modified Boeing 747-200s have been serving presidents since 1987 but the company has been looking after presidents for more than half a century. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The 4,000sq feet plane can act as a mobile command centre in the event of an attack on the United States. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In 1943, President Franklin D Roosevelt flew in a Boeing B-314 Dixie Clipper to Casablanca - the first time a sitting US president had travelled overseas by air. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Getty 4 Air Force One is a heavily modified Boeing 747 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The plane is now seen as the original Air Force One but it wasn't until the late 1950s that Boeing built the first presidential aircraft the VC 137A in the late 1950s. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR President Dwight Eisenhower was the first to use it, on a 19-day overseas tour in 1959. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In 1962, then-first lady Jackie Kennedy commissioned designer Raymond Loewy to style the plane - including a bold blue paint job because it was husband John F Kennedy's favourite colour. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Vice President Lyndon Johnson took the oath of office on board the aircraft after JFK's assassination, and the murdered president's body was transported from Dallas to Washington on board. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Getty Images 4 President John F Kennedy and wife Jackie leave Air Force One on the day he was assassinated NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR What is on Air Force One? NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Spread over three levels, it includes a Presidential suite with a large office and conference room. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A doctor, always on board, has access to a medical suite that can be used as an operating room. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The aircraft also boasts two food preparation galleys that can feed 100 people at a time. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR It also has two kitchens, which can cater for 100 people at a time, and a shower. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The plane has 87 phones and a video-teleconference system so the president can address the nation on board. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR It is outfitted with military technology and has classified communications gear and defences in case it is attacked by a missile. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Reuters 4 US President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump arrive aboard Air Force One ahead of the NATO Summit NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR What other features does Air Force One have? NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The plane can be refuelled in the air as it has a special fuel cap on its nose so a second plane can connect to it while flying above. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR This means the plane could technically stay in the air indefinitely in case of an emergency. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Air Force One is also really fast - it can reach speeds of 600mph. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR According to reports, F-16 fighter planes escorting the president's plane on September 11 had to ask Air Force One's pilot Colonel Mark Tillman to slow down. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR It's also reported to be capable of repelling airborne missiles and has a special electronic defence system that can jam enemy radars. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Electronics on board are designed to protect against an electromagnetic pulse and the aircraft is equipped with advanced secure communications equipment. aircraft Girl, reports, of Air so want aircraft
